info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 9:51PM CDT until June 14 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Garcitas Creek Near Inez affecting Victoria County.
For the Garcitas Creek...including Inez...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Garcitas Creek near Inez.
* WHEN...Until early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of crop and pasturland occurs. Secondary roads and bridges begin to flood. Livestock begin to become isolated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 21.0 feet by early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
